title: Terror adviser backs UK prosecution of jihadis but warns of influx of 'battle-hardened' fighters
text:
Britain could face an influx of hundreds of battle-hardened, dangerous jihadis, says a top ministerial terrorism adviser, as he suggested the Government should “look positively” at prosecuting them in the UK.

Jonathan Hall, the Government's independent reviewer of terrorism legislation, said the Government should “where possible” seek to prosecute British jihadis from Syria in the UK as part of its international responsibility to counter terrorism.

However, he said this could put a severe strain on police and MI5 if hundreds of them were returned in “one batch.” The security services say at least 900 Britons have left the UK to fight with Isil in Syria and Iraq in the past seven years.
